com.gc.iotools.fmt
Class GuessInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      com.gc.iotools.fmt.GuessInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class GuessInputStream
extends InputStream

InputStream that wraps the original InputStream and guess the format. If you want to use the wazformat library

To support a new format:
  • implement a new DetectorModule. The metod parse(bytes[]) should return true when the format is recognized
  • Extend the enum FormatEnum to provide the new name for the format.
  • Either register it statically in GuessFormatInputStream with the method addDetector or pass an instance in the constructor.

decode

public void decode(boolean decode)
Define if the content of the internal stream must be decoded or left unchanged. Default: false.
  • true: if a decoder is found for the internal data the data read from the external InputStream is filtered through this decoder. This also applies for recursive decoding.
  • false: the data read from GuessInputStream is the copy of the original InputStream

Parameters:
decode - whether to decode or not the content of the original stream.

getDetectedFormatsId

public FormatId[] getDetectedFormatsId()
                                throws IOException
Get the result of the detection as a FormatId array. At place 0 is the format identified for the external stream, at place 1 is the format identified after the decoder for FormatId[0] was applied.

Returns:
the array of eventually identified formats or FormatEnum.UNKNOWN if no format recognized.
Throws:
IOException - threw if some error happens reading from the internal stream.

getFormat

public final FormatEnum getFormat()
                           throws IOException
Get the result of the detection as a FormatEnum. It is a shortcut for getDetectedFormatsId()[0].format.

Returns:
the eventually identified format or FormatEnum.UNKNOWN if no format recognized.
Throws:
IOException - threw if some error happens reading from the internal stream.
See Also:
getDetectedFormatsId()

setIdentificationDepth

public void setIdentificationDepth(int level)

Set the maximum number of recursive identification allowed. 1 for no recursion (single level detection). It also represent the maximum size of the array returned by getDetectedFormatsId().

It can be set multiple times if no read() is invoked between the invocations.

Default is no recursion

Parameters:
level - Integer >= 1 indicating the number of recursive identification steps.
